info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 10 at 12:16PM EDT until October 10 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Broward.
* WHEN...Until 215 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1216 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Hollywood, Davie, Oakland Park, Lauderdale Lakes, Dania Beach, Wilton Manors, Lazy Lake, Downtown Fort Lauderdale, Franklin Park, Washington Park, Golden Heights, Port Everglades, Chula Vista, St. George, Melrose Park, Twin Lakes, Fort Lauderdale - Hollywood International Airport, Boulevard Gardens and Roosevelt Gardens. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
